title: Manganinnie
creator_contributor_role: Victorian Council for Children's Films and Television, distributor
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Literature/Australian literature - Film and video adaptations
abstract: Fictional account of the life of Manganinnie after fleeing the Aboriginal genocide in 1830s Tasmania.
description: Manganinnie, fleeing the Aboriginal genocide of 1830 in Tasmania, rescues a tiny lost white child. Together they find compassion, love and a bond that delivers them from desperation, loneliness and the terror of pursuit. Based on the novel by Beth Roberts with music by Peter Sculthorpe and a script by Ken Kelso.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: VoD Program; B2003004; In Honour of Peter Sculthorpe; Active; 2014
